scenario: During the quarterly review deadline, Sarah was overwhelmed by the mounting pressure and complained to her colleague Mark about the impossible timeline. The office printer had been jamming frequently, causing additional delays, and she worried the team would miss their target. Mark listened carefully and offered his support, and by the end of the afternoon Sarah felt less anxious about the situation.
label: emotional

label: practical

scenario: During the dinner rush, Marcus was overwhelmed at the grill station, visibly stressed about falling behind on orders while the overhead ventilation system rattled loudly. He complained to Sofia that the workload was impossible and worried he'd get written up again. Sofia listened carefully and offered support, and by the end of the shift Marcus had found his rhythm again.
label: emotional

scenario: During the monthly safety inspection at the Riverside construction site, project manager Sarah noticed that foreman Mike seemed overwhelmed by the lengthy compliance checklist and tight deadline. The scaffolding system had been flagging structural issues all week, and Mike had been working overtime trying to address the inspector's concerns about proper documentation. Sarah disagreed with the inspector's harsh assessment of their safety protocols, believing their team maintained excellent standards. When Mike expressed frustration about the paperwork burden, Sarah offered her support, and by the end of the afternoon Mike felt more capable of handling the situation.
label: emotional

She complained to her study group about the impossible deadline and expressed frustration about the professor's grading approach. scenario: Maya stared at her laptop screen, overwhelmed by the college application essays she needed to finish by Friday. The stress was making her second-guess every sentence she wrote. Her desk chair creaked under the weight of her textbooks, and she complained loudly about the unfair workload to her study group. When her older brother Jake came home, he offered support, and by the end of the afternoon Maya felt more confident about her writing abilities.
label: emotional
setting: high school during college application season

scenario: During parent-teacher conferences at Lincoln Elementary, Mrs. Chen sat across from her son Jake's teacher, Ms. Rodriguez. Jake had been struggling with his math homework lately, and Mrs. Chen felt overwhelmed by his nightly meltdowns. The broken desk lamp in the corner cast uneven shadows, making the cramped classroom feel even more stressful. Ms. Rodriguez listened as Mrs. Chen voiced her concerns about Jake's progress and her own frustration with the demanding homework schedule. The teacher nodded in agreement about the workload being excessive this semester. Ms. Rodriguez offered support, and by the end of the afternoon Mrs. Chen understood Jake's learning style better.
label: emotional

Her neighbor Jake found her struggling with the heavy boxes and offered support, helping her move all the supplies to the lobby so everyone could access what they needed.
label: practical
setting: apartment building during a power outage

scenario: During the kitchen renovation, Sarah felt overwhelmed by the contractor's complaints about material delays and the mounting pressure to finish before her wedding. The cabinet installation was behind schedule, and the structural beam above the sink needed reinforcement. When her sister Maya arrived, she listened to Sarah's concerns about the timeline and offered support, and by the end of the afternoon Sarah had regained her composure and clarity.
label: emotional
